page.title: 12The Zodiac and Glastonbury
page.content: Many tourists come to Glastonbury to experience the feelings associated with the place. These feelings, called "vibes" in modern parlance, arise from mystical and spiritual associations of the place. Apart from legends of early Christians, more recently mystics have discovered that{Druids}possibly made use of the area, and about 2700 B.C. ancient astronomer priests are believed to have laid out a twelve sign zodiac with all the normal constellations physically mapped out on the ground in the correct sequence within a ten mile radius of the town. Those believing in this pattern of the zodiac's existence say it can best be seen from the air,and many aerial maps show Pisces the fish, representing {Wearyall Hill,}and the{Tor}as part of the Aquarius outline. But sceptics dismiss all this as rubbish.
